name: The Lodge On Route 66

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights for our trip to the Grand Canyon. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. Big, heavy furniture (no generic furnishings) but watch your shins around the beds! Soft, comfy bed linens and good mattresses. We had a queen suite because no other rooms for 3 people were available, so it was a little more than we wanted to spend, but it was very nice.
reviews.title: No wonder it's ranked #1.

reviews.text: They have a pretty patio with tables surrounded by a liitle vegetable garden, so you can sit outside and enjoy the cool mountain air. There is a nice continental breakfast.
reviews.title: You want to be comfortable...

reviews.text: The motel is within walking distance to the Grand Canyon railroad depot, as well as to restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Nice Lodge, but a little pricey.

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here!
reviews.title: Great Place to stay!

reviews.text: It's no wonder the Lodge on Route 66 is rated the top hotel in Williams Arizona. Simply because it is. The location and its outside curb appeal does not inspire confidence. As we have said in the past "don't judge a book by its cover".
reviews.title: Old style only better

reviews.text: We called into this charming town on our way back from the Grand Canyon and stepped back into the past. It is an amazing place and the Lodge was top of the list on Trip Advisor. It is in the middle of town with lovely rooms. It is quiet and cool and there was a small continental breakfast. It is not a resort so there is nothing to do at The Lodge, but it is a nice place to stay the night.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for a one night stay based on Trip Advisor recommendations and we werent disappointed. We loved William itself with the quaint old street and extra effort put in to entertain tourists. The Hotel was well located and very well appointed with very friendly staff. We were able to walk up the street for a drink and meal and the next morning we wanted to get to the Canyon early so were able to have a lovely breakfast (included in room rate) in the small restaurant. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: It lived up to its reputation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, we chose this hotel because of other reviewers comments and were glad we did. It's within easy walking distance to anything in town, a good price and the reception staff were very chatty and friendly. The continental breakfast was ample to start us off for the day.
reviews.title: Worth the good reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night in late September after leaving the Grand Canyon. The next day we were on our way to Las Vegas, so it was a great location. I read all the great reviews of this property and knew right away this was the place to stay in Williams. We were not disappointed. During our week long Sedona-Flagstaff-Grand Canyon-Las Vegas trip, we stayed at a total of 6 different hotels. This by far was our favorite. We booked the Lincoln Room, #18. You walk into the room and have a couch and 2 chairs, plus flat screen TV on a stand, a dining table with 4 chairs, a mini fridge & micro, an L shaped counter with coffee maker, and storage space. Through an arch way is the separate queen bed, and through another arch way is the double vanity. The commode and tub/shower are in a separate room off of the vanity room. Loved the double vanity! That meant my husband and I could share sink space and not be in each others way. The bed and pillows super comfy, loved the sleeping bag at the end of the bed, and my only real complaint is the air was a tad noisy, but not enough to keep me awake. The room was clean, clean, clean. The towels and bath amenities also fantastic. We paid more for this room than any other room along the way, but it was worth it. The property itself is small, which is really nice, and the grounds are kept up. There is a small patio in the middle of the property to sit out on nice nights as well. The check in and out process was easy and fast. We walked along the streets of Williams, stopping at a few Rt 66 memorabilia shops and had a bite to eat before hanging out watching TV in our room. I would definitely recommend and would stay again if given the chance.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place!

reviews.text: The Lodge was a perfect stop for our 1 night stay on our way to the Grand Canyon. We traveled with a family of 6. The room was clean & comfortable, with a very cozy decor. The furniture is a bit large for the space, but it served our needs very well (I'd much prefer 2 queen beds over 2 full beds any day). I must admit I would have not chosen this place, with its less than desirable curb appeal, if it wasn't for all the positive feedback from Trip Advisor; and yet again it did not disappoint! The staff was very friendly and helpful. And the continental breakfast was AWESOME! The kids loved it; especially the make-your-own Belgian waffles. I would highly recommend staying here to anyone.
reviews.title: Great place for the family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Lodge has been recently refurbished and they have done a good job. The room was "cozy" boardering a little on the small size but it was very clean & tidy. Good comfy bed and all the usual essentials provided. Breakfast overal was OK but on a positive note the coffee was excellent. OveralI would say this is a good motel for a one night stay.
reviews.title: Drive USA 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Lodge for 1 night before going on Grand Canyon railway - very clean room and very good continental breakfast. Although the romm was not large it was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Would recommend the Lodge if staying in Williams - good value for the money.
reviews.title: Well worth a stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked one night here based on all of the positive Tripadvisor reviews and convenient location to the Grand Canyon. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly clerk dressed in shorts and a zip up hoodie. A little too casual for a "Luxury" Lodge maybe? The Lodge is an ok place to stay but I would not call it "Affordable Luxury" like they have it on their sign out front. I really didn't see any luxury in the $120 room I stayed in. I feel like the pictures they show on their website are a little misguiding. We had a room with 2 queen beds that was very cramped and barely had room to put our suitcases down without having to walk over them. Getting in and out of bed I scraped my shin and banged my knee up - not a lot of fun. The Beds were pretty comfortable but I laughed when I found out the Bedspreads are actually an unzipped camping sleeping bag - again more "Luxury"?
reviews.title: The Lodge on Route 66 - Upscale Luxury??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend some blackout drapes for the guestrooms - the courtyard light shines right in at night and beware of the 3 AM LOUD train rolling through town - not a good wake up call.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: The continental breakfast was great - loved the coffee. We ate right down the street for dinner at the Pine Country Inn - great Country Fried Steak and the pies really were good too.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure to stay here!

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in this motel in Williams, a 1 hour drive from the entrance to the South Rim of the Grand Canyon.
reviews.title: confortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good place to stop if you are too tired after the long drive from Las Vegas .
reviews.title: Great Room and Surprise
Very Charming
reviews.text: This is a comfortable motel, rooms are spacious, modern and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is very helpful and friendy.
reviews.title: Great stay!
Very good surprise
reviews.text: It has free wi-fi and a reasonable breakfast.

aka: The Lodge On Route 66 Hotel Williams
